newsitem.title: FINLAND: Baltic Ice- Ice receding, more restrictions lifted.
newsitem.headline: Baltic Ice- Ice receding, more restrictions lifted.

text.p: Ice levels eased and more restrictions were lifted in the Gulf of Finland the Gulf of Bothnia, the Finnish Institute of Marine Research said in its twice-weekly ice report on Monday.

It lifted all restrictions to Porvoo and Rauma and allowed vessels with ice-classes IA and IB and deadweights of 2,000 tonnes to Vaasa. Ships with ice class IA and deadweights of 2,000 tonnes would again be assisted to Kokkola and Pietarsaari.
The Swedish restriction to Ornskioldsvik was lifted and Russian restrictions were unchanged, an institute official said.
Five icebreakers were assisting near St Petersburg and Vyborg in the eastern Gulf of Finland, one near Loviisa, five in the northern end of the Gulf of Bothnia and two in the middle.
One ice-breaker was still on station outside Parnu in the Gulf of Riga. (Temperatures of nearby isotherms, degrees Celsius)
PORT TEMP ICE TYPE THICKNESS RESTRICTIONS (Mar 10)
St Petersburg n/a Level/rafted/ 20-40 Russian ice class 13,
Vyborg n/a Level/rafted/ 30-40 Russian ice class 13,
Kotka,Hamina, n/a Fast/level 10-35 Ice classes I, II,
Oulu n/a Fast/compact/ 40-65 Ice class IA,
Kemi n/a Rafted/ridged 40-80 Ice class IA
Lulea n/a Fast 30-50 Ice class IA,
Kokkola, n/a Level/compact/ 30-60 Ice class IA,
Vaasa n/a Fast 10-40 Ice classs IA, IB

NOTES: New ice - forming, thin and still moving. Fast ice - not moving level flat ice. Level ice - thick flat ice. Consolidated/compact - compact close ice. Windrow ice - reshaped by wind, thickness varies sharply. Rafted - ridges forming, 10-20 cm thick. Ridged - ridged or hummocked ice. Open - floes with water at rate of 4-6:10. Close ice - floes tightly packed.
